definition: without any better option/to have to/to be forced to
only/merely/just/but
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to

sentences.english: The weather became so bad that they had to turn back.
sentences.chinese: 天氣變得很壞，他們只好原路而歸了。

sentences.english: She get left her key in the office or get to toce the gate open.
sentences.chinese: 她把鑰匙忘在了辦公室，只好強行把門打開。

sentences.english: I have no idea what they are going to say, so I'll have to play it by ear.
sentences.chinese: 我一點不知道他們將會說什麼，所以我只好見機行事。

sentences.english: It was raining cats and dogs outside, so we had to stay at home.
sentences.chinese: 外面大雨滂沱，我們只好呆在家裏。

sentences.english: L2. Due to the destination is an inland city, we have to arrange sea-land intermodal transportation.
sentences.chinese: 由於目的地是內陸城市，我們只好安排海陸聯運。

sentences.english: Had to wear long pants, but still hold tight the shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 只好穿上長衣長褲，卻仍然抱緊雙肩。

sentences.english: The barrel was nearly empty and I had to climb right inside to get my apple.
sentences.chinese: 蘋果桶快空了，我只好鑽進去拿蘋果。

sentences.english: Yellow to porch suffer Hong Kong police, who had to go to taking home for help.
sentences.chinese: 黃以軒遭受香港警方通緝，只好前去去晏家求助。

sentences.english: Now I have to take a later flight.
sentences.chinese: 現在我只好坐晚一般的航班了。

sentences.english: We had to abandon the car and walk the rest of the way.
sentences.chinese: 我們只好棄車，步行趕剩下的路。

sentences.english: We had to stuff the ventilator shafts up to stop the smoke entering the room.
sentences.chinese: 爲了阻止煙進入室內，我們只好把通風道堵起來。

sentences.english: But the method used to adjust kerning to adjust.
sentences.chinese: 沒辦法，只好用調整字距的方法來調整。

sentences.english: I wanted his support, so I couldn’t laugh.
sentences.chinese: 我希望得到他的支持，只好憋住笑。

sentences.english: Youll have to make do with cold meat for dinner.
sentences.chinese: 晚餐你只好將就一下用冷肉了。

sentences.english: Because before Wang Lan owes the white dragon favor, she promised to come down.
sentences.chinese: 因爲之前汪蘭欠着白龍人情，她只好答應下來。
所以我們只好繞道而行。

definition: to have no alternative but to/to be obliged to
you might as well (do it)/simply/just
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
to act against one's will/to have no alternative but to/to have to/to have no choice/must
to drop (subject etc)
thereupon/as a result/consequently/thus/hence
to have no way out/to have no alternative
to brace oneself to do sth/to put a bold face on it/to summon up courage/to force oneself to
straightforward/clear-cut/blunt (e.g. statement)/you might as well/simply
helpless/without choice/for lack of better option/grudgingly/willy-nilly/nolens volens/abbr. for 無可奈何|无可奈何[wu2 ke3 nai4 he2]
to have no alternative/to be helpless
can't persuade/unable to make (sb) change their mind/unable to resist (sb)
to settle for second best/the next best thing
have no choice or option but to/cannot but/have to/can't help it/can't avoid
at a loss/unable to do anything about it/to have no choice
to suffer/fig. reluctantly
